original_title: Growth through govt elected by people – Harsha
original_body_lines: COLOMBO (News 1st); SJB MP Dr. Harha De Silva speaking on CNBC's Squawk box say that Inflation in Sri Lanka is coming down but it’s still ‘hard on the people.
"Things have gotten a lot better.Fuel queues have disappeared.Things are coming back to some sort of normalcy. The rupee has stabilized at around 320 for the time being to the dollar," he added.
The MP also went on to note that growth is something that Sri Lanka needs to deal with through a government elected with a mandate of the people.
